name: Texture Synthesizer
description: This algorithm is an implementation of the open source Clouds module by Ã‰milie Gillet. This implementation should behave and sound identical to the original. Any demos or tutorials you may find online for the original module apply just as well to this version. The user manual for the original module can be found [here](https://pichenettes.github.io/mutable-instruments-documentation/modules/clouds/manual/). The documentation below assumes some familiarity with this.
use_cases: Looping and delay effects with spectral manipulation
gui_description: The interface mimics the original Clouds module, featuring knobs for primary parameters (Mode, Position, Size, etc.), routing controls for input/output buses, and a layout designed for intuitive granular synthesis manipulation.

parameters.name: Freeze
parameters.description: "This latching parameter stops the recording of incoming audio. Granularization is now performed on the last few seconds of audio kept in memory in the module." (From original Clouds manual)

parameters.name: Position
parameters.description: "Selects from which part of the recording buffer the audio grains are played. Turn the knob clockwise to travel back in time." (From original Clouds manual)

parameters.name: Size
parameters.description: "Sets the grain size." (From original Clouds manual)

parameters.name: Pitch
parameters.description: "Sets the grain transposition." (From original Clouds manual)

parameters.name: Coarse tune
parameters.description: "Sets the grain pitch in semitones." (From original Clouds manual)

parameters.name: Fine tune
parameters.description: "Sets the grain pitch in cents." (From original Clouds manual)

parameters.name: Density
parameters.description: "At 12 o'clock, no grains are generated. Turn clockwise and grains will be sown randomly, counter-clockwise and they will be played at a constant rate. The further you turn, the higher the overlap between grains." (From original Clouds manual)

parameters.name: Texture
parameters.description: "Morphs through various shapes of grain envelopes: square (boxcar), triangle, and then Hann window. Past 2 o'clock, activates a diffuser which smears transients." (From original Clouds manual)

parameters.name: Spread
parameters.description: "Stereo spread (amount of random panning/balance applied to the grains)." (From original Clouds manual)

parameters.name: Feedback
parameters.description: "Sets the amount of feedback." (From original Clouds manual)

parameters.name: Reverb
parameters.description: "Sets the amount of reverb applied to the output." (From original Clouds manual)

parameters.name: Output mode
parameters.description: "The standard Add/Replace mode selector." (From original Clouds manual)

input_ports.name: Audio Input
input_ports.description: Main audio signal input, configurable as mono or stereo via the 'Input channels' parameter.

input_ports.name: V/Octave CV
input_ports.description: Pitch control voltage input for modulating grain transposition (connected to specified bus).

input_ports.name: Trigger CV
input_ports.description: External trigger signal input for controlling granular events (connected to specified bus).

input_ports.name: Left input
input_ports.description: "The left audio input bus." (From original Clouds manual)

input_ports.name: Right input
input_ports.description: "The right audio input bus." (From original Clouds manual)

input_ports.name: V/Oct input
input_ports.description: "The bus to use for a V/octave pitch CV." (From original Clouds manual)

input_ports.name: Trigger input
input_ports.description: "The bus to use for a trigger input." (From original Clouds manual)

output_ports.name: Audio Output
output_ports.description: Processed audio output, configurable as mono or stereo via the 'Buffer channels' parameter.

output_ports.name: Left output
output_ports.description: "The left audio output bus." (From original Clouds manual)

output_ports.name: Right output
output_ports.description: "The right audio output bus." (From original Clouds manual)
